job_title: Group Home Manager in Madison, WI
pros: Flexible, cooperative environment doing great work in the community.
cons: Too many hours, they pay over time, but it is a 24 hour business and you will work many hours.

review_title: Great for new counsellors to get experience and training
pros: Great team Dedicated compassionate staff
cons: Low pay for hard work

pros: Being able to make a difference in the residents lives by helping them with daily needs. Building relationships and trust with residents so they feel safe to talk about what they may be struggling with.
cons: Constant turnover and bribed to come in even if you made it clear you are unavailable. Pay is beyond unacceptable for the work expected. Often take care of duties we are not qualified to do for management since we are not notified of urgent situations which require paperwork as well as contacting members of residents team to have any questions asked as well calling doctors/pharmacists. Micromanaging and always tried to find something wrong making me nervous and because of personal relationships with upper management. Little concern for residents daily needs unless it’s an emergency that has to be addressed for documentation. There is not enough food for the amount of residents to cover the meals on the menu. The grocery list is questioned and often changed to the buyers. It is insisted that the clients are the most important. The fire alarm has been disconnected for 2 months.

pros: None that I can think of at this time.
cons: Poor leadership, toxic work environment that does not support staff, low pay, four directors left within one year, multiple supervisors have resigned, disgruntled staff with high turnover, no current leadership, no vision, no direction. I would caution anyone applying for a position here. It is not a supportive work environment.

pros: The Dane County Care Center has a good team.
cons: The hours are 80+ a week, with on-call system 24/7.

review_title: Mental Health Facility with No Mental Health Support
pros: Lots of flexibility with Management on workload and project schedule. Macro style of management that allows you to be creative in your job if you are inexperience in your field and have good work ethics. Flexbile schedule if you're not working at the programs. In general everyone has a good heart.
cons: Overworked, lack of support, lack of understanding of needs, bare minimum staffing, high turn over rate, no formal processess of any kind of requests, everyone is either lost of doing their own thing. You must be a strong and assertive individual to survive in an environment where you do not get much training and guidance. Onboarding is usually always a mess. Lack of communication. Needs to know bases on any kind of changes down to starting a program- you will know when they go live. Macro style also allows staff who doesnt want to work to do bare minimum.

review_title: Poor Management all the way to the Top
pros: Tbh honest there is none. Don't work here!
cons:
Lack of formal structure to the organization leaves a 50 year old company chaotic and looking as though it's in it's infancy. 

High Turn over rates on all levels, except for highest upper management. 
High Burn out amongst all direct client facing positions. 
Management not culturally competent. 
Frequently was witness to sexist, homophobic, transphobic, racist comments to staff and clients. 
Was expected to endure poor treatment from staff and clients with no recourse. "Suck it up " mentality. 
Poor Healthcare Benefits despite cost. Still paying off bills from getting routing labs done (apparently the plan they chose didn't cover standard labs...)
Low Pay for expected job duties and stress.

job_title: PATH Outreach Worker in Madison, WI
pros: Flexible for a cm job, outreach community can be great.
cons: …I think you’ll find out.

job_title: Human Service Specialist in Madison, WI
pros: hands-on experience, clinically relevant, interesting patient population
cons: small, organization issues, cleanliness not great

pros: Nothing at all. This company sucks.
cons: If you want to hate your life and work in a toxic environment that’s also dangerous .. work here!

job_title: CCS Service Facilitator in Madison, WI
pros: The clients are great but that’s it
cons: Underpaid overworked very poor management

review_title: The Finest Employees on the Front Line
job_title: Human Services Specialist IV in Sun Prairie, WI
pros: Teamwork, skills development, varied tasks.
cons: Disinterested administrators, wages, employee turnover

review_title: The Worst Employer I've Ever Had
pros: They will hire you without any experience.
cons: Outdated systems, high turnover, poor communication [overall], inadequate training, poor scheduling, inappropriate and/ or contradictory behaviors modeled by management, management is out of touch with employees and client needs, unsecured units, theft frequent, management will run employees ragged; taking advantage of dedicated individuals, lack of clear policies, lack of continuity between management, employees and clientele, lack of empathy or compassion, lack of education (credentials), experience and knowledge of the field, management unwilling to invest in property maintenance or up-to-date records keeping systems; putting protected information at risk for exposure or breech, employees' concerns are not heard or kept confidential, opportunities are promised but there is no room for growth, especially since employees burn out faster than opportunities arise.

pros: The mission that Tellurian has is spot on- they truly try to help those that are stuggling with mental illness, addiction and homelessness. While I wouldn't say it is a big nor a small company, they do seem to have a family type feel. They try to work with you and be flexible and accommodating the best they can, while trying to keep everyone's best interest in mind- the client, other workers and the business.
cons: Obviously not everything is perfect- sometimes there can be issues between co-workers but I think that's more a reflection on those specific individuals rather than the company.

pros: We are a tight knit team but really could use some new talent to assist and grow with our clients
cons: Sharing the open hours regularly ultimately drains a good team leaving us all a bit noodle brained

job_title: Human Services Specialist in La Crosse, WI
pros:
Good way to get some experience
Good co workers
cons:
Low pay 
Outdated systems 
High turnover
Supervisors seemed lost and over worked.. genuinely good people but seemed to be lacking the resources

review_title: Great place for entry level social services experience
job_title: Human Services Specialist in La Crosse, WI
pros: The work environment is welcoming and friendly. The client work is rewarding as well!
cons: The shifts were 12-hour minimum. There were no 8-hour shifts or anything like that.
